column4: Folks: does anyone know how to tell Ubuntu/Gnome to use the Splix driver and not the GDI driver for my Samsung laser printer?
I have the "splix" package installed, but it doesn't seem to come with a PPD file.

Um, I don't think cups is a type of driver, is it? In any case openprinting.org suggests splix, and I've used splix successfully in the past with this printer, and the current gdi driver is not working.
brother recommend using the linux built in cups system for their printers
this is not a brother printer. Cups is not a driver.
Hm, the PPD used to be in the package: http://packages.ubuntu.com/lucid/amd64/splix/filelist but now it is generated on install: http://packages.ubuntu.com/natty/amd64/splix/filelist
But it doesn't seem to be present on my system.
Although I'm not sure precisely what directory it would be in.
thanks anyway, but your suggestions are not helping.
if you open printers and then properties you can see and change the driver there
thanks. I already knew that much.
Hm, it seems like the ppd really ought to show up in /usr/share/ppd/splix, but no such directory is created when I purge and reinstall splix...
use the terminal to install splix and see if there are any error messages
thanks again, but I've already used a terminal to apt-get install splix and see if there were any error messages. There were none.
any linux help on samsung's site?

I haven't looked at Samsung's site--I definitely want to use the open source splix drivers instead of drivers provided by the company if I can help it. I've opened a ticket with Ubuntu: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/splix/+bug/793741
